org.artoolkit.ar6.base

Class ARActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • Activity
      • org.artoolkit.ar6.base.ARActivity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CameraEventListener

    public abstract class ARActivity
extends Activity
implements CameraEventListener
    An activity which can be subclassed to create an AR application. ARActivity handles almost all of the required operations to create a simple augmented reality application.

    ARActivity automatically creates a camera preview surface and an OpenGL surface view, and arranges these correctly in the user interface.The subclass simply needs to provide a FrameLayout object which will be populated with these UI components, using supplyFrameLayout.

    To create a custom AR experience, the subclass should also provide a custom renderer using Renderer. This allows the subclass to handle OpenGL drawing calls on its own.

      protected int pattSize
      For any square template (pattern) markers, the number of rows and columns in the template.
      protected ARRenderer renderer
      Renderer to use.

      Android logging tag for this class.

      • TAG

        protected static final java.lang.String TAG
        Android logging tag for this class.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • renderer

        protected ARRenderer renderer
        Renderer to use. This is provided by the subclass using Renderer().

      • mainLayout

        protected FrameLayout mainLayout
        Layout that will be filled with the camera preview and GL views. This is provided by the subclass using supplyFrameLayout().

      • pattSize

        protected int pattSize
        For any square template (pattern) markers, the number of rows and columns in the template. May not be less than 16 or more than AR_PATT_SIZE1_MAX.

      • pattCountMax

        protected int pattCountMax
        For any square template (pattern) markers, the maximum number of markers that may be loaded for a single matching pass. Must be > 0.

      • cameraPreviewStarted

        public void cameraPreviewStarted(int width,
                        int height,
                        int rate,
                        int cameraIndex,
                        boolean cameraIsFrontFacing)
        Description copied from interface: CameraEventListener
        Called when the camera preview is started. The video dimensions and frame rate are passed through, along with information about the camera.
        Specified by:
        cameraPreviewStarted in interface CameraEventListener
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the video image in pixels.
        height - The height of the video image in pixels.
        rate - The capture rate in frames per second.
        cameraIndex - Zero-based index of the camera in use. If only one camera is present, will be 0.
        cameraIsFrontFacing - false if camera is rear-facing (the default) or true if camera is facing toward the user.

      • cameraPreviewFrame

        public void cameraPreviewFrame(byte[] frame)
        Description copied from interface: CameraEventListener
        Called when the camera preview has a new frame ready.
        Specified by:
        cameraPreviewFrame in interface CameraEventListener
        Parameters:
        frame - A byte array from the camera, in the camera's capture format.
